body:
Oh, I see -- I was reading the patch queue in the reverse order.  That makes more sense now.  :)

I don't know if TF as a whole has a preference, but for my part I'd prefer to rebase -i so that we don't commit changes that we then undo.  That is, small commits are good, but only if they're incrementally correct.  (And if it's a pain to do that, certainly in this case I'd be totally fine squashing this whole thing into one commit.)

But it's not a big deal.

body_text:
Oh, I see -- I was reading the patch queue in the reverse order.  That makes more sense now.  :)
I don't know if TF as a whole has a preference, but for my part I'd prefer to rebase -i so that we don't commit changes that we then undo.  That is, small commits are good, but only if they're incrementally correct.  (And if it's a pain to do that, certainly in this case I'd be totally fine squashing this whole thing into one commit.)
But it's not a big deal.
